group_1.narration: I was never bullied.
All the ways normal girls have fun...@Like watching funny TV shows, or talking@about the cool, new teacher, or products@with some cute character on them… I dunno.
I have friends who include@me in all of those things.
They hang out with me@after class, without me@even having to say anything.
So why…@Why do I feel this way?
There's a me that nods along with their @stories, that listens when they sing @karaoke, that laughs along with them...
But it's also like there's another me,@floating above, just looking down@and watching it all happen.
I'll just be sitting there, and all of @a sudden, I start feeling like that.
Even though my friends are@talking to me, calling out@my name, "Shizuku, Shizuku!"
I'll just be there, consumed @by that other me.
When that happens... @I just feel like such an awful person…
My friends at school, my teachers,@the old lady who lives next door,@my father, my mother...
I can't find any problems @with any of them.
But whenever I take a step,@I always feel so unsteady,@like I'm walking on a trampoline.
Yeah.@I'm sure the one with the problem is me.
"What kinds of things do you like?"@"What do you wanna be when you're older?"@I never know what to say when@people ask me those questions.
What will I be doing@in five years? In ten years?@Where will I be?
It feels as though the future@me is covered in a thick fog,@concealing herself from me.
"I like music, so I'd love to@work at a record company."
I wonder if being so sure of myself@that I could say something like that@would make me feel like I was@standing on firmer ground.

group_1.textRight: Shizuku, could you look after the shop?

group_1.textLeft: (I want to stand my ground,@but it's never solid enough.)
